option.name: -output <file>
-o <file>
option.description: write output to the specified <file>

option.name: -config <file>
option.description: set configuration options from the specified <file>

option.name: -file <file>
-f <file>
option.description: write errors and warnings to the specified <file>

option.name: -modify
-m
option.description: modify the original input files

option.name: -indent
-i
option.description: indent element content

option.name: -wrap <column>
-w <column>
option.description: wrap text at the specified <column>. 0 is assumed if <column> is missing. When this option is omitted, the default of the configuration option 'wrap' applies.

option.name: -upper
-u
option.description: force tags to upper case

option.name: -clean
-c
option.description: replace FONT, NOBR and CENTER tags with CSS

option.name: -bare
-b
option.description: strip out smart quotes and em dashes, etc.

option.name: -gdoc
-g
option.description: produce clean version of html exported by Google Docs

option.name: -numeric
-n
option.description: output numeric rather than named entities

option.name: -errors
-e
option.description: show only errors and warnings

option.name: -quiet
-q
option.description: suppress nonessential output

option.name: -omit
option.description: omit optional start tags and end tags

option.name: -xml
option.description: specify the input is well formed XML

option.name: -asxml
-asxhtml
option.description: convert HTML to well formed XHTML

option.name: -ashtml
option.description: force XHTML to well formed HTML

option.name: -access <level>
option.description: do additional accessibility checks (<level> = 0, 1, 2, 3). 0 is assumed if <level> is missing.

option.name: -raw
option.description: output values above 127 without conversion to entities

option.name: -ascii
option.description: use ISO-8859-1 for input, US-ASCII for output

option.name: -latin0
option.description: use ISO-8859-15 for input, US-ASCII for output

option.name: -latin1
option.description: use ISO-8859-1 for both input and output

option.name: -iso2022
option.description: use ISO-2022 for both input and output

option.name: -utf8
option.description: use UTF-8 for both input and output

option.name: -mac
option.description: use MacRoman for input, US-ASCII for output

option.name: -win1252
option.description: use Windows-1252 for input, US-ASCII for output

option.name: -ibm858
option.description: use IBM-858 (CP850+Euro) for input, US-ASCII for output

option.name: -utf16le
option.description: use UTF-16LE for both input and output

option.name: -utf16be
option.description: use UTF-16BE for both input and output

option.name: -utf16
option.description: use UTF-16 for both input and output

option.name: -big5
option.description: use Big5 for both input and output

option.name: -shiftjis
option.description: use Shift_JIS for both input and output

option.name: -version
-v
option.description: show the version of Tidy

option.name: -help
-h
option.description: list the command line options

option.name: -help-config
option.description: list all configuration options

option.name: -show-config
option.description: list the current configuration settings

option.name: -help-option <option>
option.description: show a description of the <option>

option.name: -language <lang>
option.description: set Tidy's output language to <lang>. Specify '-language help' for more help. Use before output-causing arguments to ensure the language takes effect, e.g.,`tidy -lang es -lang help`.

option.name: -xml-help
option.description: list the command line options in XML format

option.name: -xml-config
option.description: list all configuration options in XML format

option.name: -xml-strings
option.description: output all of Tidy's strings in XML format

option.name: -xml-error-strings
option.description: output error constants and strings in XML format

option.name: -xml-options-strings
option.description: output option descriptions in XML format
